name: Sachin Hegde
summary: Sachin Hegde is a seasoned Software Engineering Manager specializing in AI, with extensive experience in leading engineering teams and developing scalable software solutions.
work_history: Superhuman: Senior Software Engineering Manager (Oct 2022 - Present), Principal Software Engineer (Jan 2022 - Oct 2022), Senior Software Engineer (Oct 2019 - Jan 2022). Zillow Group: Senior Software Engineer (Jun 2018 - Oct 2019). PayPal: Member Of Technical Staff 1 (Apr 2017 - Jun 2018), Senior Software Engineer (Apr 2015 - Mar 2017), Software Engineer (Sep 2013 - Mar 2015), User Interface Engineering Intern (Jun 2012 - Aug 2012). Isotope Advertising: Technical Designer (Jun 2011 - Aug 2011). Evergreen Seamless Pipes and Tubes Pvt Ltd.: Marketing Media Intern (Jun 2010 - Aug 2010).
project_history: At PayPal, led the development of a platform for analytics and UI widgets, scaling to 4000+ merchant sites. Co-architected 'F0', a JS framework for interactive forms, and led its implementation. Conducted training for PayPal's merchant onboarding app, enabling localization in 200+ regions.
skills: Artificial Intelligence, Large Language Models, Engineering Management, JavaScript, Node.js, Python, HTML5, CSS, GraphQL, React, webpack, react-router, JQuery, Photoshop, Illustrator
education: Carnegie Mellon University: BS in Computer Science, Minor in Art (2009 - 2013). The International School, Bangalore: International Baccalaureate (2005 - 2009)

PayPal
4 years 10 months
Member Of Technical Staff 1 
April 2017 - June 2018 (1 year 3 months)
San Francisco Bay Area
• Selected to be one of 4 founding engineers of a special VP project, now
consisting of over 18 FTEs
• Built a platform to provide analytics and run UI widgets on e-commerce
websites; scaled to run on over 4000 merchant sites, with over 80,000 daily
page impressions, in under a year
• Served as an architect for 2 scrum teams, assigned to oversee 15 engineers
working on 2 large code bases
• Gave a talk at JSConf@PayPal 2017, titled “Building a third-party widget
platform with webpack and react-router”
 
Page 1 of 3

 
 
• Replaced several scattered API routes with a single GraphQL endpoint that
now serves as a marketing API endpoint for several of PayPal's marketing
client apps
• Conducted a bi-weekly “clean code session” series to help enable teams
within the merchant organization to identify and eliminate technical debt on
their projects
• Gave a talk at JSConf@PayPal 2018, titled “Front-tier GraphQL: Migrating
vanilla express routes to apollo-server”
Senior Software Engineer
April 2015 - March 2017 (2 years)
San Francisco Bay Area
• Took the initiative to prototype an alternative approach to building an existing
app, influenced management to allocate a team to build out the prototype as a
full-fledged JS framework
• Co-architected and led a team to build out the framework, called “F0”, which
allowed developers to create rich, interactive multi-page forms by declaring
simple JSON objects
• Used TDD to build and publish over 20 fully unit tested node modules to
PayPal’s internal npm registry
• 2 PayPal apps were rewritten entirely with f0 on the client side, resulting in
smaller, more maintainable codebases
• F0 was presented at Node Summit in San Francisco in 2016, in a talk titled
“Specialization with Dynamic React forms”
Software Engineer
September 2013 - March 2015 (1 year 7 months)
San Francisco Bay Area
Worked as one of the core developers responsible for scaling PayPal’s
merchant onboarding app to allow for several teams to work on a common
codebase. I conducted training sessions for 8 development teams across
3 international locations, who went on to launch localized flows to over 200
regions, in under a year.
PayPal
